name: autoreject
description: Data-driven automated artifact rejection and channel interpolation for EEG epochs using machine learning-based cross-validation
author: AutoCleanEEG Team

n_interpolate.description: Number of channels to interpolate during cross-validation grid search

consensus.description: Consensus percentages for determining bad epochs (0.0-1.0)

n_jobs.description: Number of parallel jobs for cross-validation (-1 for all cores)

cv.description: Number of cross-validation folds for parameter optimization

random_state.description: Random seed for reproducible cross-validation splits

picks.description: Channel names to include (null for all EEG channels)

outputs.data: Cleaned epochs with bad epochs removed and bad channels interpolated

metadata.interpolated_channels: List of channels interpolated in any epoch

use_cases: Objective quality control for EEG epochs
Data-driven artifact rejection without manual inspection
limitations: Requires minimum 20-30 epochs for reliable parameter estimation
Best results with 100+ epochs for robust cross-validation
Processing time: 1-10 minutes for typical datasets
Aggressive rejection (>50%) may indicate poor data quality

comparison.vs_manual_rejection: Automated, objective, reproducible vs. time-consuming, subjective
comparison.vs_simple_thresholding: Data-driven thresholds vs. fixed thresholds across all channels
comparison.vs_wavelet_threshold: Epoch-level rejection vs. continuous data denoising

references.name: AutoReject: Automated artifact rejection for MEG and EEG data
references.authors: Jas, M., Engemann, D. A., Bekhti, Y., Raimondo, F., & Gramfort, A.

references.name: Automated rejection and repair of bad trials in MEG/EEG
references.authors: Jas, M., Engemann, D. A., Raimondo, F., Bekhti, Y., & Gramfort, A.
references.conference: 2016 International Workshop on Pattern Recognition in Neuroimaging (PRNI)
